result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Jurgenson

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 9:45 a.m. 
Clerk: Heather.  
INCLUDES: 22CM48, 22CF113, 22CF221, 22CF276.
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, with Atty John Wallace via Zoom.

Atty Wallace was not able to speak with Defendant prior to today's hearing.
COURT notes tracking cases have a prelim set for April 4th.
Atty Wallace wishes to combine prelime on April 4th.
Preliminary time limits WAIVED.
COURT finds good cause to toll time limits until next hearing.

DATES:

Defendant's Phone: 715-301-3854.

Adjourned: 9:48 a.m.
Request for Documents and Motion for Discovery

Review hearing on March 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on March 21, 2022 at 09:40 am.

No contact with victim(s): A.A.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No possession or use of dangerous weapons, including imitation firearms (bb guns, airsoft, ect). No driving without valid DL. Prints and photograph. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2, 3, 4****** supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 3:52 p.m.

State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from Secure, with Atty Jack Mathie, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CM's. 

COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): A.A.B.
- No possession or use of dangerous weapons, including imitation firearms (bb guns, airsoft, ect). 
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2, 3, 4****** supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
